Posts.Content: MsReba wrote: I have recently found a new lump in my left breast...at about the 9 o'clock position, near the nipple area.  The same breast that I have a fibroadenoma in (it's been biopsied).  While showering, I also found a small lump in my left armpit area.  I have had a lot of pain and discomfort in my left ribcage and burning in the chest area between my breasts.  I can't get in to the doctor for 2 weeks (she's on holidays).  Should I be worried?  Has anyone else experienced this kind of pain?  I'm not sure if it is even associated with the breast lump, but it has me a bit worried.  Thanks for any information you can give me on this. Jackie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New Lump & Rib Pain MsReba MsReba

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2008 02:38AM MsReba wrote: Well, I went to the doctor and she says it feels like a large cyst, so I will wait another 5 weeks and if it doesn't disappear by then, she will try to drain it.  As for the small lump under my arm, she thinks that it is just a small fat pocket and not a swollen lymph node.  Seems strange to have a 'fat pocket' when I'm not a very big person to begin with...guess my body can still find places to 'store' fat. The rest of the pains, may be due to menopausal changes.  Thanks for listening to me. Jackie
Posts.Title: New Lump & Rib Pain MsReba MsReba

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2008 01:50AM MsReba wrote: I'm sitting here trying to tell myself that I'm strong and can advocate for myself, but in reality I'm worried that I won't be able to stand up to my doctor on Tuesday.  I asked her if she would do a FNA on my left breast lump if it wasn't gone by my April appointment and she indicated that she would if it was causing me pain.  All the pain that I was having in Feb is pretty much gone, so now I'm worried that she will brush me off again and just tell me not to worry.  The lump is not painful anymore but it has not disappeared either.  It has been here since the end of Dec 2007.  I thought that it would disappear in a few months if it was a cyst, but it hasn't.  Has anyone had a FNA done before?  Is it painful?  Should I be concerned?  What if she tells me not to worry about it?  My appointment is on Tuesday and I'm already starting to stress about going to see her.  What would you do if you were me?  Should I take someone else with me to be my advocate?  Thanks for letting me ramble on again.
Posts.Title: New Lump & Rib Pain MsReba MsReba

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 03:29AM MsReba wrote: Thank you Leaf.  Just talking to someone about this is helpful and I don't feel as alone when I come here.  I don't really want to bother anyone at home about it until I have some answers.  It may end up being nothing, so I don't want to worry others unnecessarily.  I did a lot of thinking today and decided that if I have a difficult time with my doctor on Tuesday, then I will tell my hubby about the lump and get him to go back to the doctor with me.  I'll keep you posted.
Posts.Title: New Lump & Rib Pain MsReba MsReba

Posts.Content: MsReba wrote: I'm really starting to get worried now about these fibroadenomas/lumps. I not only have a solid lump in each breast (left breast lump bigger than right), but the burning chest pain between my breasts (chest wall pain) has now spread down the left side of my rib cage. My breast burns, the lower part of my ribs are burning and tender. I called the doctor to try to get in to see her on Thursday or Friday, but she is booked up until Wednesday. AAAAAAHHHHH!!! Has anyone else experienced this and had it be cancer? I keep getting told that the pain is a good sign, so it's not cancer. I'm going crazy! Log in to post a reply
